author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: A metallurgical laborer earns 30% more per hour in Guipúzcoa than an engineer in Cuenca
text:
A laborer in the metallurgical sector in Guipúzcoa earns 30% more per hour than an engineer in Cuenca, according to the report ‘Collective bargaining in the metal industry in 2023′ prepared by the sector’s employers’ association, Confemetal, in which it is stated manifest the dispersion in the remunerations included in the different provincial metal agreements.
In fact, engineers working in the metal sector of up to 14 Spanish provinces They receive an hourly remuneration lower than that earned by a laborer in Guipúzcoa, the province that pays the best for this category of workers.
Specifically, a laborer in the metallurgical industry who works in Guipúzcoa charges 15.2 euros per hour an amount that exceeds what engineers in Cuenca (11.7 euros), Badajoz (12.15 euros), Cáceres (12.31 euros), Lleida (12.34 euros), Jaén (12, 57 euros), Ciudad Real (12.81 euros), Murcia (13.34 euros), Castellón (13.81 euros), Lugo (13.89 euros), Salamanca (14.04 euros), Soria (14.09 euros), Ourense (14.16 euros), Almería (14.22 euros) and Las Palmas de Gran Canaria (14.56 euros).
Confemetal explains that all these amounts They are based on the tables of the provincial collective agreements of the iron and steel industry in 2023 and, to calculate them, the base salary, group salary, extra pay and certain bonuses, such as transportation, are taken into account. Other remuneration concepts are left out, such as those that correspond to specific circumstances of a job, overtime or seniority.
According to this report, in the metal sector the salary per hour worked in the category of former laborer stood at a average of 11.12 euros, above the 10.39 euros in 2022.
What’s more, all of the four professional groups analyzed in this study (former laborer, worker, administrative and licensed engineer) increased their hourly wages compared to 2022. The state average of remuneration per hour worked is 12.1 euros for the worker officer, compared to 11.31 euros in 2022; of 12.57 euros for the administrative officer (11.76 euros in 2022) and 16.98 euros for the engineer (15.8 euros in 2022).
The province that pays the most There are numerous differences between provinces on the hourly wage of each group. Guipúzcoa and Navarra are the provinces that best reward metal laborers (15.2 and 14.6 euros per hour, respectively) and Lleida, Cuenca and Cáceres pay them the least (7.93, 8.7 and 9.36 euros per hour, respectively).
In the case of engineers, Guipúzcoa, Girona and Pontevedra are the provinces that pay them the best with an hourly wage of 25.98; 24.11 and 22.58 euros, respectively. At the other extreme are Cuenca (11.7 euros) and Badajoz (12.15 euros per hour).
In the worker category Guadalajara (9.77 euros per hour) and Cuenca (9.89 euros) present the lowest figures, in contrast to Guipúzcoa and Navarra, where they earn the most, with 16.88 and 15.74 euros per hour, respectively.
Finally, within the administrative category Guipúzcoa and Navarra are also the ones that pay the most (18.35 and 15.74 euros per hour, respectively). On the opposite side, with the lowest hourly wages, are Cuenca (10.02 euros) and Cáceres (10.26 euros).
